description:
Land surface model simulation. Same as land-hist except starting from either 1700 (for models that typically start in 1850) or 1850 (for models that typically start in 1700).   Use the same land model configuration as used in the coupled CMIP6 historical simulations. Include representation of land cover, land use and land management. All applicable land use features should be active.  Forced with historical observed climate. Include transient CO2, Nitrogen deposition and aerosol deposition etc. 
This experiment can and likely will be a different configuration across models due to different representations of land use for each model.
keywords: LUMIP, Tier 1, historical, All Management, AM, All  LULCC, 1700, 1850
rationale: Land cover versus land management change. To assess the relative impact of land cover and incrementally more comprehensive land management change on fluxes of water, energy, and carbon. Comparison with land-hist indicates impact of pre-1850 land use change.

requirements.keywords: 1850, 2014, Historical, Recent Past, pre-industrial to present, IPCC
requirements.label: 1850-2014 165yrs

requirements.description: Spin up of the land surface model should follow the TRENDY protocol which calls for recycling of the climate mean and variability from two decades of the GSWP3 forcing dataset (1831–1850). Land use should be held constant at 1850 as in the DECK 1850 coupled control simulation (piControl). CO2 and all other forcings should be held constant at 1850 levels during spinup.
requirements.keywords: TRENDY, land surface, spin up, GSWP3
requirements.label: TRENDY spin up for GSWP3

requirements.description: For the interim period from 1700 to the first year of the GSWP3 forcing dataset, the forcing data should continue to be recycled but all other forcings (land-use, CO2, etc.) should be as in the piControl simulation.
requirements.keywords: TRENDY, land surface, 1700 to first forcing year, interim forcing, GSWP3
requirements.label: TRENDY Interim Forcing for GSWP3

requirements.description: Apply Global Soil Wetness Project phase three (GSWP3) forcing data for offline land surface models running the LS3MIP historical simulation land-hist is provided by the LS3MIP.
requirements.label: Historical GSWP3 Forcing

requirements.description: Global gridded land-use forcing datasets to link historical land-use data and future projections.  This new generation of “land use harmonization” (LUH2) builds upon past work from CMIP5, and includes updated inputs, higher spatial resolution, more detailed land-use transitions, and the addition of important agricultural management layers.
requirements.label: Historical Land Use

requirements.description: Realistic transient anthropogenic ignition and suppression of fire.
requirements.label: Transient Fire Management

requirements.description: Impose historical concentrations of atmospheric Carbon Dioxide (CO2).
requirements.label: CO2 Historical

requirements.description: Impose time varying (transient) historical nitrogen (N) deposition.
requirements.label: Historical Nitrogen deposition

requirements.description: Impose time varying (transient) historical aerosol deposition.
requirements.label: Historical Aerosol Deposition

requirements.description: Simplified historical solar forcing requirement for models that represent solar forcing as a constant rather than with specifications for spectral irradiance, proton forcing, electron forcing and cosmic ray forcing.  e.g. land surface models.
requirements.label: Simplified Historical Solar Forcing
